title: Not compiling after adding the GAT `Self: 'a` bounds

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: ICEBreaker-Cleanup-Crew
labels.description: Helping to "clean up" bugs with minimal examples and bisections

labels.name: GATs-triaged
labels.description: Issues using the `generic_associated_types` feature that have been triaged

body:
After https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89970 was merged, project [relp](https://github.com/vandenheuvel/relp) no longer compiled as expected: I needed to add a few [`Self: 'a` bounds](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87479).

After [I did just that](https://github.com/vandenheuvel/relp/commit/aa471b3272cb53f8f497217585f89599cc9343c3), I was left with the following error:
```
error[E0477]: the type `RemoveRows<'_, MP>` does not fulfill the required lifetime
  --> src/algorithm/two_phase/mod.rs:57:21
   |
57 |                     phase_two::primal::<_, _, SteepestDescentAlongObjective<_>>(&mut non_artificial)
   |                     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0477`.
```
After I made [the following change](https://github.com/vandenheuvel/relp/commit/525e6161c989d173cc54a03a7b19625800ccea66):
```rust
-pub fn primal<IM, MP, PR>(
-    tableau: &mut Tableau<IM, NonArtificial<MP>>,
+pub fn primal<'provider, IM, MP, PR>(
+    tableau: &mut Tableau<IM, NonArtificial<'provider, MP>>,
 ) -> OptimizationResult<IM::F>
 where
-    IM: InverseMaintener<F: im_ops::FieldHR + im_ops::Column<<MP::Column as Column>::F>>,
-    for<'r> IM::F: im_ops::Cost<MP::Cost<'r>>,
+    IM: InverseMaintener<F:
+        im_ops::FieldHR +
+        im_ops::Column<<MP::Column as Column>::F> +
+        im_ops::Cost<MP::Cost<'provider>> +
+    >,
```
`cargo build` succeeded.

The core of this bug report is the question why the extra change above could have been necessary, as #89970 should not have influenced that.

Summarized from a private conversation with @jackh726.
